summary: This is a Daily Activity Report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 8, 2019. It details inmate movements, staff shortages, equipment issues, and administrative data. The report is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there on August 10, 2019.

events.title: MCC Daily Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: Daily activity report covering inmate placements (including to Special Housing Unit and suicide watch), new admissions, releases, staff shortages leading to vacated posts, and administrative leave/overtime data.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report documents significant staff shortages, leading to vacated correctional assignments on multiple shifts (Internal #2, 10 South #2, SHU #4).
Two inmates (Bright #76309-054 and Gentille #71230-054) were placed on suicide watch during the Evening Watch Shift on August 8, 2019.
The facility's Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative.
The report shows inmate movements in and out of the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with Almanzar and Benjamin being transferred there.
This routine administrative report was generated on August 9, 2019, one day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the same facility on August 10, 2019.
